page.title: 03Owley
page.content: Owley is a dairy farm with 150 cows of up to 2 years of age, 173 Guernsey milking cows, 4 bulls and 153 calves. The buildings are all purpose built including a slurry store and a milking parlour. Owley's milking parlour goes slowly round and round while the cows are being milked. While they are being milked they each have a little bowl which they eat out of; they eat square concentrate blocks. After they have been milked they have to get off, but sometimes the cows go round again because they want more food. The milking cows are housed in cubicles and the calves in calf pens. They are fed silage in the cow yard and in their mangers. Because the farm buildings at Owley are specialised, only 3 men are needed to look after the dairy herd.
